OurPaths

OurPaths Terms of Use

Effective May 1, 2014

OurPaths provides people with the ability to create global communities. Individuals in these communities share stories, memories and media to commemorate someone important to them; they also can provide or receive support and information on the subject of death and grieving.

Information We Collect And Store


Our technology allows people to create memorials as versatile and individualized as the people who make them. OurPaths is committed to supporting and protecting our users'personal expression as well as their privacy and sense of security. To do that effectively, we require that OurPaths users - whether visitors, members, curators or owners - share certain community standards. The common denominations are respect, courtesy and kindness.


Please read these terms and conditions ("Terms of Use") carefully. By using this Application, you agree to abide by these Terms of Use. If you do not agree with any of these Terms of Use, do not use the Application.

The terms "you" and "yours" refers to the person using OurPaths (the "Application"). The terms "we", "our", "us" and "OurPaths" refer to Myriata, Inc.,owner of OurPaths. Myriata, Inc. is a corporation organized under the laws of the State of Delaware.

OurPaths Rules of Use


OurPaths is as interactive as you want it to be. Depending on what you do on the Application, you have certain rights and obligations. No matter what your level of access, however, you are required to abide by the Rules of Use.

We are a community that embraces freedom of expression and celebrates the diversity of our global population. But we also believe in and require that you abide by the Golden Rule: treat others as you would have others treat you. As a condition of using the Application, you agree to the following:

  1. You will not submit any user content or upload, download, post, store or otherwise make available any content that you know or reasonably should know is misappropriated, infringing or dilutive, including, without limitation, any content that infringes or violates any third party intellectual property rights or rights of publicity, and you will ensure that you have received all necessary third party licenses or other permissions as may be required to submit, upload, download, post, store or otherwise make available any content;
  2. You will not submit any user content or upload, download, post, store or otherwise make available any material that you know or reasonably suspect is inaccurate, misleading, defamatory or invades another’s privacy;
  3. You will not upload, download, post, store or otherwise make available any content that is unlawful or obscene;
  4. You will not upload, download, post, store or otherwise make available any content that contains personal threats, glorifies violence, or constitutes bullying, abusive or hateful speech;
  5. You will not use the Application to attack others on the basis of their race, ethnicity, national origin, religion, gender, sexual orientation, disability or any other immutable characteristic or condition;
  6. You will not engage in religious proselytizing on others’ memorials;
  7. You will not stalk or harass other users;
  8. You will not vandalize or desecrate memorials or rooms;
  9. You will not contact users for commercial purposes without prior permission or post unauthorized commercial communications on others’ memorials;
  10. You will not create a presence for a commercial entity;
  11. You will not upload viruses or other malicious code;
  12. You will provide only truthful personal information;
  13. You will provide only truthful information about any person who is the subject of a memorial;
  14. You will not pretend to be anyone that you are not nor will you impersonate or misrepresent yourself as another person (including celebrities), entity, Application user, OurPaths employee or representative, or otherwise misrepresent yourself or any affiliation you have with any company or entity;
  15. You will not use the Application if you are under 13;
  16. You will not share your password or otherwise jeopardize the security of your account;
  17. You will not access another’s account;
  18. You will comply with all applicable laws in connection with your use of this Application;
  19. You will not use this Application to engage in the planning or commission of illegal activity;
  20. You will not use this Application to disrupt others’ gatherings;
  21. You will not attempt to or violate, circumvent, reverse-engineer, disassemble or otherwise tamper with the Application’s content or with the content of private or public memorials nor will you or assist another person in attempting to do so;
  22. You will not do anything that could disable, overburden or impair the proper working or appearance of the Application or others’ memorials.
  23. You will not facilitate or encourage any violations of the Terms of Use.
  24. You are not located in a country that is subject to a U.S. Government embargo or that has been designated by the U.S. Government as a “terrorist supporting” country and you are not listed on any U.S. Government list of prohibited or restricted parties.

OurPaths reserves the right to and will block from the Application any user who violates any of the Terms of Use. It specifically reserves the right to block any user or remove any content it reasonably believes, in its sole discretion, has violated any of the Rules of Use. In rare cases, that could include removal of a memorial, room or rooms.

Reporting Abuse


We want OurPaths to be a safe place to connect, share, learn, grieve, discover and communicate. We are committed to providing an environment in which shared memories and stories can change lives and make history come alive. To create that kind of community, we need to respect that the world is a diverse place with diverse opinions and multiple modes of expression. You may not always be comfortable with what you see.

But there are limits, particularly in public rooms.

If you object to content of any kind on one of your memorials or rooms, even if it may not violate OurPaths’ Terms of Use, you have complete authority as an Owner or Curator to delete it. You also have the authority to ban individual users from your memorials at your sole discretion and without speaking with anyone. We ask, however, that you take the time to report objectionable conduct to us at support@OurPaths.com. This allows us to take appropriate action and to take further action if the problem is repeated on other memorials by the same user or group of users.

If you encounter objectionable material on a site you are visiting that you believe violates our Terms of Use or otherwise infringes or violates any third party intellectual property rights, rights of publicity or other third party rights, please also report it to us at support@OurPaths.com. Because of the diversity of the OurPaths’ community, bear in mind that what is disagreeable or disturbing to you may nonetheless be within the bounds of our Rules of Use and, therefore, we may not require that it be removed. In that case, you have the option and ability to cut ties with that person or memorial if you do not want to view the objectionable material.

Notwithstanding our commitment to provide all users with a safe and respectful community, we also remind you that you use the Application at your sole risk and OurPaths shall have no liability for material that you may find objectionable, nor does OurPaths guarantee the accuracy of any information placed on the Application by third parties.

Your Rights and Obligations


Your Cooperation and Notification


You agree to cooperate with all reasonable requests of OurPaths and will notify OurPaths promptly upon learning of any actual or suspected breach of these Terms of Use or upon learning of any unauthorized use or abuse of this Application.

Users

You do not have to register in order to use OurPaths’ informational sections or to browse featured or popular memorials. Those who want to sign the guestbook, add wishes or prayers, create or contribute to an interactive obituary or build memorials and meeting places must register and become a Member. Different levels of access are granted based upon what kind of user you choose to be.

Visitors are users who choose not to open an OurPaths account. Visitors are free to browse all non-private sites on the Application and to utilize all the resources and support we offer. However, they are not able to interact, i.e., add guest comments, wishes or prayers or purchase offerings at the sites.

Members are users who have registered to create an OurPaths account. This allows interactive access. There is no charge for becoming a Member. Members may add wishes or prayers and sign the guestbook in any public room. Registration also gives a user the ability to create memorials and rooms of their own and invite others to visit those spaces. Members have access, upon invitation, to private rooms. They may buy furnishings, photo frames, furniture and other objects to place in their and others’ rooms, depending on the access granted by the Owner or Curator of the memorial.

Guests are users who are invited to view a memorial, usually through a social media site like Facebook or Google+. Guests can be Visitors or Members.

Contributors are Guests who are invited by the Owner or Curator of the memorial to contribute photos, memories and videos to the Timeline. One of the unique aspects of OurPaths is the ability for a number of users to easily contribute to the storytelling.

Owners and Curators create, design and have complete authority over the memorials and rooms they build. The Owner is the purchaser of the memorial and has the option to assign a Curator at his or her discretion. Both the Curator and Owner may provide information, photos and videos that initially create the Biography and Timeline. If they choose, they may grant others access to add events, photos and video to the Timeline by inviting them to be Contributors. The Owner or Curator chooses the venue/room for the 3D part of the memorial and has sole control over the objects, photos and furnishings in the rooms.

The Owner or Curator also determines whether the memorials and rooms are public or private. The Owner or Curator of a memorial has full authority to delete or otherwise remove any material from the memorial that he or she believes, in his or her sole discretion, is inappropriate, unwanted or objectionable. The Owner or Curator also has the right to ban individual users from the memorial or room.

The Memorials

The OurPaths Application provides users with the ability to create 3D interactive memorials. These memorials can be the project of one person, a family, a group of people or literally groups all around the world. Some Owners will want to collaborate with others; some will want it to be a solo project. Some of you will put together memorials for a funeral service or life celebration. Others will want a 21st century obituary for the world to see. Others will want it to be the equivalent of a private shrine or the entrance to a private virtual party.

No matter what kind of memorial you build, the Owner controls all access to and content on the memorial.

Public Memorials are just that: public. They can be viewed in their entirety by anyone visiting the Application or anyone who searches for information on that person on the Internet. If you do not specifically choose to make the memorial private, it will be public by default.

In a public memorial, the Owner determines who else (if anyone) will be able to contribute content to the Biography or Timeline of the memorial, which is how photos and video are usually added. Members will be able to add Wishes or Prayers, which can include photos, and sign the guestbook.

Public memorials may be included in the Featured Memorials on the Home page of the Application. They also are used to populate the Home page’s list of most popular memorials. Our hope is that OurPaths’ Home page will be filled with public memorials to unsung heroes, favorite relatives, little-known scientists, life-changing mentors, under-appreciated artists and Members’ loved ones from around the world

Private memorials are memorials in which portions are private. These can be open to as few or as many users as the Owner decides. They can be designated as invitation-only.

Even a private memorial will have one page – the Biography – that is public. To get any further into the memorial, i.e., to a room or rooms or to the Timeline, requires an invitation from the Owner. Who to invite and what access to provide is in the sole control of the Owner. The memorial can be a collection of private rooms that are open only to you and those you select. For example, you can create a room for yourself, a room for family, a room for your loved one’s school friends or athletic groups. Each room can have its individual guest list. You can allow other people to contribute photos, video, important events in the deceased’s life, or you can limit it only to what you want in that room or Timeline. Remember that there is no limit to the number of memorials that can be made for a single person. Feel free to make your memorial your own.

Non-Revocable Grant of Access to Memorials By OurPaths Administrators

As an Owner or Curator, you grant full, complete and non-revocable access to OurPaths’ administrators, including but not limited to employees, contractors and other third parties in order to perform routine maintenance, perform updates, and to ensure the memorial is being used in accordance with the Application’s Rules and Terms of Use. OurPaths retains the right, in its sole discretion, to remove, alter or close access to a memorial that it reasonably believes violates the Terms of Use. In most cases, such action will not be taken without communication with and permission of the Owner or Curator.

As a user, you agree that you will not attempt to and will not damage, corrupt, tamper with or infect this Application, its Content or any information or telecommunication system of OurPaths with a virus or other malicious computer program. You will only use this Application for the permitted purposes stated in these Terms of Use, and will not engage in abusive activity with respect to this Application, or undertake any other activity that may adversely affect the use or enjoyment of this Application by any person. You are prohibited from using any services or facilities provided in connection with this Application to compromise security or tamper with system resources and/or accounts. The use or distribution of tools designed for compromising security (e.g., password guessing programs, cracking tools or network probing tools) is strictly prohibited. If you become involved in any violation of system security, OurPaths reserves the right to release your details to system administrators at other sites and law enforcement authorities in order to assist them in resolving security incidents.

Dispute Resolution Agreement; Applicable Law and Forum

By using this Application you agree to abide by the terms of this Dispute Resolution Procedure. Please read this provision carefully to ensure that you understand it. You are agreeing to binding arbitration as the sole and exclusive means of resolving any and all existing or potential disputes or claims with OurPaths. If you do not agree with this provision, do not use this Application.

Agreement to Act in Good Faith and Cooperate

With respect to any and all disputes arising out of or in connection with this Application or these Terms of Use, OurPaths and you agree to negotiate in good faith and undertake reasonable efforts to cooperate with one another in order to achieve a mutually satisfactory resolution.

Agreement to Binding Individual Arbitration

OurPaths and you agree that any and all disputes relating to or arising from the use of this Application, these Terms of Use or any other matter between you and OurPaths shall be exclusively governed by and construed in accordance with the Federal Arbitration Act, 9 U.S. C. Section 2, et seq. (the “Agreement”). This means that each party waives the right to a trial by jury or to participate in a class action for damages for all claims, including but not limited to those based in contract, common law, tort, statute, administrative action, equity or any other legal theory. Instead, we agree to resolve the dispute solely and exclusively through binding arbitration.

An arbitration is an alternative dispute resolution process that avoids the costs of court for both you and OurPaths. Together the parties will choose a mutually acceptable arbitrator, who is not necessarily a judge, who listens to the evidence and makes a decision based on the law and application of the law to this Agreement and any facts either side believes are relevant.

Any demand for arbitration by either party shall be filed within the statute of limitation that is applicable to the claim(s) upon which arbitration is sought or required. Any failure to demand arbitration within this period shall constitute a waiver of all rights to raise any claims in any forum arising out of any dispute that was subject to arbitration.

The arbitration will be governed by the Commercial Arbitration Rules (“Rules”) of the American Arbitration Association (“AAA”). The AAA Rules are available online at www.adr.org, or by calling the AAA at 1-800-778-7879. The AAA can provide you with information about the arbitration process that is designed for non-lawyers.

To initiate an arbitration, either OurPaths or you must file a Notice of Arbitration, which is available on the AAA website. If you initiate the arbitration, you will need to pay the initial filing fee. Under this Agreement, you will not have to pay any more for the arbitration than you would pay in court filing fees to press your claim.

The arbitrator will be chosen under the process set forth in AAA Rules. The arbitrator is bound by the terms of this Agreement and OurPaths’ Terms of Use. All issues are for the arbitrator to decide, except that issues relating to the scope and enforceability of the arbitration provision are for a court to decide.

Unless you and OurPaths agree otherwise, any arbitration hearings will take place in the county of your home address. If the claim is for $10,000 or less, we agree that the party initiating arbitration may choose whether the arbitration will be conducted solely on the basis of documents submitted to the arbitrator, through a telephonic hearing, or by an in-person hearing as established by the AAA Rules. If the claim exceeds $10,000, the right to a hearing will be determined by the AAA Rules. Regardless of the manner in which the arbitration is conducted, the arbitrator shall issue a reasoned written decision sufficient to explain the essential findings and conclusions on which the award is based.

If the arbitrator finds in your favor in any respect on the merits of your claim, the arbitrator will determine the amount of damages or other remedies, if any, that you are entitled to receive. Damages and remedies shall be determined consistent with the applicable law and any additional provisions contained in this Agreement.

The arbitrator’s decision shall be conclusive and binding, and it may thereafter be confirmed as a judgment by the court of applicable jurisdiction, subject only to challenge on the grounds under applicable law.

Waiver of Class Arbitration

OurPaths and you agree that any and all disputes relating to or arising from the use of this Application, these Terms of Use or any other matter between you and OurPaths shall be brought by you in your individual capacity, and not as a plaintiff or class member in any purported class proceeding. Unless such waiver is inconsistent with applicable state law, the parties also agree to waive any right to bring a representative action.

The arbitrator’s decision shall be conclusive and binding, and it may thereafter be confirmed as a judgment by the court of applicable jurisdiction, subject only to challenge on the grounds under applicable California law.

Permitted Use of Preliminary Injunctive Relief

OurPaths and you agree that either party is entitled to obtain preliminary injunctive relief to the extent allowed by law to enforce any of the terms of these Terms of Use pending a final arbitral decision.

Contact Information

If you have any questions regarding these Terms of Use or this Application, please contact us by email at support@ourpaths.com or legal@ourpaths.com
